00033 #include "arm_timer.h"
00034 #include "hal_arm.h"
00035 #include "mac_event.h"
00036 #include "arm_timer_event.h"

00044 /*============================ MACROS & DEFINES =============================*/
00045 
00046 typedef struct
00047 {
00048     u16 time;                  
00049     u8 ID;
00050     void (*callback) (void);   
00051 } timerEventT;
00052 
00053 #define TIMER_EVENTS_MAX 30
00054 #define LONG_TIMER_EVENTS_MAX 3
00055 
00056 static timerEventT timerEvents[TIMER_EVENTS_MAX];
00057 
00058 #define MS_PER_TICK (1)   
00059 
00060 static u8 getUniqueID(void);
00061 
00062 /*============================ IMPLEMENTATION ===============================*/
00063 
00081 u8 macSetAlarm_arm(u16 time, void(*callback)(void))
00082 {
00083     u8 i;
00084     u32 ticks;
00085     volatile u8 empty_timer = false;
00086 
00087     // Search for free event structure
00088     for (i=0;i<TIMER_EVENTS_MAX;i++)
00089     {
00090         if (!timerEvents[i].time)
00091         {
00092             // Prevent a default re-use of last timer slot.
00093             empty_timer = true;
00094 
00095             // Found a free one, use this one
00096             break;
00097         }
00098     }
00099 
00100 
00101     if (!empty_timer)
00102     {
00103         // Out of timers to use, just quit
00104         return 0;
00105     }
00106 
00107     // Store the timer details in the array
00108     ticks = ((u32)time)/MS_PER_TICK;
00109 
00110     if (!ticks)
00111         // make sure we have at least one tick
00112         ticks++;
00113     timerEvents[i].time = ticks;
00114     timerEvents[i].callback = callback;
00115     // Don't return zero as a timer ID
00116     timerEvents[i].ID = getUniqueID();
00117 
00118     // Leave timer on all the time. This also gives a heartbeat on the SAM7X-EK board.
00119 
00120     return timerEvents[i].ID;
00121 }
00122 
00128 static u8 getUniqueID(void)
00129 {
00130     static u8 currentTimerID;
00131     u8 i,goodID;
00132 
00133     currentTimerID++;
00134     for(;;)
00135     {
00136         // Don't return zero as an ID, macSetAlarm returns zero on error
00137         if (!currentTimerID)
00138             currentTimerID++;
00139 
00140         // See if this ID is used by any active timer
00141         goodID = 1;
00142         for (i=0;i<TIMER_EVENTS_MAX;i++)
00143             if (timerEvents[i].ID == currentTimerID)
00144                 goodID = 0;
00145 
00146         if (goodID)
00147             // Unused ID, use this one
00148             return currentTimerID;
00149         // ID already exists, try again skippy
00150         currentTimerID++;
00151     }
00152 }
00153 
00160 void macTimerEnd_arm(u8 ID)
00161 {
00162     u8 i;
00163 
00164     // Search for timer with ID
00165     for (i=0;i<TIMER_EVENTS_MAX;i++)
00166     {
00167         if (timerEvents[i].ID == ID)
00168         {
00169             // Stop this timer
00170             timerEvents[i].time = 0;
00171             return;
00172         }
00173     }
00174 }
00175 
00183 void timerInit_arm(void)
00184 {
00185     u32 val = 0;
00186 
00187     /*********** SETUP PMC **********/
00188 
00189     /* Turn on the Master Clock for the peripheral (TC1 = 13). */
00190     PMC_PCER = TC1;
00191 
00192     /*********** SETUP DEBUG PIO PIN TOGGLE - Interferes wit uTasker **********/
00193 
00194     // TIOB1 is connected to PB26, turn it on for output to see if we can
00195     // see the toggling.
00196     //    PIO_OER_B = PB26;
00197 
00198     // Disable PIO control of the line and allow peripheral control.
00199     //    PIO_PDR_B = PB26;
00200 
00201     // Assign IO control to peripheral A function of the PIOA Controller.
00202     //    PIO_ASR_B = PB26;
00203 
00204     /*********** SETUP TC1 **********/
00205 
00206     // Disable the timer/counter by setting the TC_CLKDIS bit in the
00207     // channel control register.
00208     TC1_CCR = TC_CLKDIS;
00209 
00210     // Reading the status register will clear any pending interrupt.
00211     val = TC1_SR;
00212 
00213     // In the channel mode register we select the main clock divided by
00214     // 2 as our clock source. The value of the counter will be
00215     // incremented at a positive edge from the clock source. Furthermore
00216     // we enable the compare mode trigger, which will reset the counter
00217     // when it reaches the value in the compare register.
00218     // Finally we select the waveform mode and toggle the output.
00219     //TC1_CMR = (TC_CLKS_MCK2 | TC_CPCTRG | TC_WAVE | TC_EEVT_XC1 | TC_BCPC_TOGGLE_OUTPUT);
00220     TC1_CMR = (TC_CLKS_MCK2 | TC_CPCTRG |TC_WAVE);
00221 
00222     // Implement a 1 ms interval. Note: uTasker MASTER_CLOCK has value
00223     // (in Hz) of the PLL output.
00224     TC1_RC = 0x5DE8; // decimal 24040 - empirical...
00225 
00226     // Enable RC compare interrupts by setting the related bit in the
00227     // interrupt enable register.
00228     TC1_IER = TC_CPCS;
00229 
00230     /*********** SETUP AIC **********/
00231 
00232     // Set the vector. Cast to int to eliminate compiler warning.
00233     (AIC_SVR(TC1_ID)) = (u32)ApiTimerIntr;
00234 
00235     // Initialize to edge triggered with defined priority.
00236     (AIC_SMR(TC1_ID)) = (AIC_SRCTYPE_INT_EDGE_TRIGGERED | 3);
00237 
00238     return;
00239 }
00240 
00241 
00246 void timerStart_arm(void)
00247 {
00248     u32 val = 0;
00249 
00250     // Reading the status register will clear any pending interrupt.
00251     val = TC1_SR;
00252 
00253     // Clear interrupt.
00254     AIC_ICCR = PID13;
00255 
00256     // Disable the timer/counter by setting the TC_CLKDIS bit in the
00257     // channel control register.
00258     TC1_CCR = TC_CLKDIS;
00259 
00260     // Enable the timer.
00261     TC1_CCR = TC_CLKEN;
00262 
00263     // Enable the interrupt.
00264     AIC_IECR =  PID13;
00265 
00266     // Start the timer.
00267     TC1_CCR = TC_SWTRG;
00268 }
00269 
00270 volatile int val;
00271 u8 i;
00272 timer_event_object_t event;
00278 void ApiTimerIntr(void)
00279 {
00280     // Reading the status register will clear any pending interrupt.
00281     val = TC1_SR;
00282 
00283     // Disable timer isr's.
00284     TC1_IDR = TC_CPCS;
00285 
00286     // Send the address to read.
00287     fnInUserInterrupt(1); // entering;
00288 
00289     // check for pending events
00290     for (i=0;i<TIMER_EVENTS_MAX;i++)
00291     {
00292         if (timerEvents[i].time)
00293         {
00294             // this timer event is live, check for expiration
00295             if (!--timerEvents[i].time)
00296             {
00297                 // Timer expired, queue the associated callback
00298                 event.event = TIMER_EVENT_TIMER;  // Event type, see event_t for details.
00299                 event.data = (u8*)timerEvents[i].callback;
00300                 timer_put_event(&event);
00301             }
00302         }
00303     }
00304 
00305     fnInUserInterrupt(0); // leaving
00306 
00307     // Enable timer isr's.
00308     TC1_IER = TC_CPCS;
00309 }
